meanings.definition: To give up or hand over control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: He surrendered his toy to his little sister.
meanings.sent2: The criminal surrendered to the police without a fight.
meanings.sent3: The cat surrendered the mouse to the dog, who promptly lost interest.
meanings.sent4: The student surrendered his seat in the front row to the new student.
meanings.sent5: The pirate surrendered his treasure map to the captain of the ship.

meanings.definition: To yield to the power, control, or possession of another.
meanings.sent1: She surrendered her decision to her parents' wishes.
meanings.sent2: The country surrendered to the invading army after a long battle.
meanings.sent3: The cake surrendered to the temptation of the hungry children.
meanings.sent4: The tree surrendered its leaves to the autumn wind.
meanings.sent5: The knight surrendered his sword to the victorious opponent.

meanings.definition: To submit to an enemy or opponent by ceasing resistance.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers surrendered to the enemy forces to avoid further bloodshed.
meanings.sent2: The boxer surrendered the match to his stronger opponent.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door finally surrendered to the locksmith's skills.
meanings.sent4: The sun surrendered to the night, painting the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The athlete surrendered to exhaustion after running the marathon.
